intro: Chromolaena mendezii, commonly known as the Mexican fireweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and yellowish-orange flowers. It is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and clearings, due to its adaptability to various soil types. Chromolaena mendezii is also known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and vegetative propagation.
